records.quoteNum: Yes. It is time to unite as one force. Together we will witness victory.
I do not... Let me see this letter.
Hmm... It be true. Enrico has sent men to help us.
That will do, Ira. I am sure our friends have heard of her nature. If not, they will know soon enough.
Die, bastards!
I have lost over thirty men in the last month. My force is down to the people you see here. But, I do have a few trusted people living in the Arulco countryside.
Yes... Carlos be my close advisor. He is right. He usually be right. Making a safe route to Drassen to get supplies be a priority.
It does not seem right at this moment.
I... require... emergency.. treatment.
I can spare Ira. She is quick learner and knows the priest well. I believe he might even have some passion for her.
Die, bastards!
A donation! I will make certain it goes to good use.
Good. The people of Omerta have you to thank for their food and supplies. It is through your hardwork and the generosity of Father Walker that we enjoy the basics of life, once again.

Yes, as the countryside becomes safe we too shall join, Carlos. We must be one force united. It be the path to victory... Dimitri will serve you well. His skill throwing a knife will save you many an unwanted battle.
We must have patience, Carlos. Our guests, I am sure, are doing what they can.
You have expanded the base of operations. Two villages are now liberated. This be a most encouraging sign.
I must express my appreciation, four towns are now under our control. I sense Deidranna does not sleep peacefully.
With 5 villages liberated, I feel confident that the people of the countryside are free from her tyranny. Carlos and I are available to join with your group now.
I am impressed with your leadership. I will join because it is best for Arulco.
Enrico? Chivaldori? Most suspicious. I question his reasons.
An act of aggression against one of us is an act of aggression against all of us. Your fate is decided!
We are short of food, too, Miguel. We need safe passage to Drassen or more people will die.
The time is not right. I am needed in Omerta.
Do not move and no one will die.
Wounded. I will die for sure.
An act of aggression against one of us is an act of aggression against all of us. Your fate is decided!
It will aid our efforts. Thank you.
Are you sure this is wise, Miguel?
This situation has grown desperate. Omerta remains without supplies for its people. When will this change?
Our people are suffering in hunger. You must do something. It cannot continue without the loss of more life.
You have made progress, but we must exercise caution. We have not heard the last from Deidranna.
I see hope in the eyes of the people, a hope I have not seen in a long time. But I shall deny myself this feeling until victory is within our hands.
Almost half the country is ours, but we still have much work to do.
All right. I could be of help with some of the ins and outs of this country and its people. But I must tell you... I'm not a professional like you guys.
You will pay for what you've done!
Miguel's rebel force has been together for almost two decades. They are trustworthy and loyal. They will accept you as one of their own as long as you do no harm.
I'm afraid my marksmanship is a little weak for a soldier. Miguel used me mostly as a medic and a look out. Anyways, I'm sure we'll make out okay. Let's get going... I'll lead the way.
She is evil. A driven bitch.
I am in need of... medical attention.
You will pay for what you've done!
Hmm. Thanks.
You will pay for your mistake with your life!
Why have you brought them here? Have you lost your mind, woman? You bring death to all of us.
Fatima say they are here to help us. She say she have proof, Carlos.
I would like this. I can learn much.
I do not have time.
I bleed... Hurts much.
I stay with Miguel. He must decide.
You have impressed Miguel. He speaks highly of you.
You will pay for your mistake with your life!
I like money.
In respect of your husband, I take your word. We will go down. But if you make mistake, Fatima, you will die with them.
Aye. No hard feelings. I can still be takin' care of your explosive needs.
It be settled then. I be workin' with ya.
Blimey bastard!
Blimey bastard!
Need a bandaging now!
Many thanks. May the devil forget you exist.
You best be takin' care of your business before we can do any.
Maybe ya'd fancy a look at me wares before you be shelling out the dough.
That be encouraging.
You can count on me for nothin' 'til your debt be paid.
The name's Devin Connell. You be lucky ya bumped into me. I have a fine selection of goods that ya might be interested in. Things that go bang be me specialty.
Aye. I could put some of me explosive knowledge to practice. Knowledge like that don't come on the cheap, ya know. And ya be asking me to turn me back on a highly profitable business.
Blimey bastard!
Need a bandaging now!
You best be takin' care of your business before we can do any.
Me sorry. For little while me visit Arulco. Maybe you change mind.
Okay, me ready now.
Naughty person...
Naughty person...
Me hurt... bad.
Blood stop. Thank you.
Talk after naughty men die..
Me no have money. Thank you.
You owe me money. When you pay?
Me make big travels. See world in truck me borrow from stranger. No save enough money to buy one. Me have much fun. Meet people.
It be long time. Me want to do it again. We can use truck. No more hurting feet. Me ask for only small cost.
You deceitful bastard!
Stop! Okay, you know who I am. We can make a deal. How would you like to have the use of my talents? I'm an excellent sniper. Very comfortable on rooftops. Can pick off just about anything you want.
You should have backed out when you had the chance!
Still a lot of fighting going on here. Not a good time to be talking.
I need a doctor...
Appreciated.
Okay... We got a deal. Just treat me like any of the others.
Don't be expecting me to do anything for it.
In case you hadn't noticed, I have a gun. Perhaps we can talk like professionals here.
Oh, what the hell... I can't pass on the chance to avenge my son's death. Just feed me every once in a while, okay?
I'm up to it! I can't wait to get my hands around her neck.
Burn in hell! You heartless bastard.
I need to get med...a doctor.
You don't scare me. There's nothing left to scare.
I need to get med...a doctor.
Thanks. Feeling better already.
I know you're busy. Ya got a war to fight and all. I should be grateful just for the chance to breath air, but I'm hurtin' bad and I could use some medical attention...
I'd feel better if you took care of the guards before we got into any long conversations.
Are you sure there's no one around? Last thing I'd want to do is run into a guard.
I'm sure I can put that to use.
I ain't got nothing to say to you until you pay me the money you owe me.
I was caged up for over a month. A month longer than most people imprisoned in Tixa. They usually don't make it past the first day!
My crime? I was told to attend one of the Queen's speeches and to clap loudly. My kid got sick, and I forgot all about it. They came for me the same night.
Could be my last chance to watch the bitch die. Yeah... I got a score to settle.
Only reason I'm probably still alive is that my brother, Matt, runs a mining operation in Alma. That was enough to make sure the guards brought me my food first. There was never enough to go around.
Burn in hell! You heartless bastard.
It's good to see you too, Matt. There was a time when I thought that would never happen.
Yeah... I got a serious score to settle.
Jeez! Do you know how little twenty bucks gets ya? Ah, well... Have it your way.
A lot of people are sure going to be surprised when they see me around again.
You ruthless son of a dog.
I can't deal with this. The pain's... painful.
I told you everything. I swear!
I can't deal with this. The pain's... painful.
I heard some shooting. Is everything okay?
Let me know when everything's okay...
Money's always good.
I'd appreciate the money you still owe me. Until then, I haven't really got much to say to you.
You must be part of that group of mercenaries we've been hearing about. Ya guys are going save our country, I know it... You've already saved me.
Gordon has lost his mind. They beat that poor guy to a pulp, then let him recover enough so they could beat him again. It's best to just leave him alone.
I consider myself lucky. I only spent a couple of days in Tixa - which is nothing compared to Dynamo Duncan. He's an oldtimer. Don't know how he survived.
You want to know why I'm in Tixa? Because of my parents. Turned me in for growing a couple of plants. They're rich, and they're friends with the Queen. Just like everyone else who lives in Balime.
Gettin' back at those responsible for putting me in Tixa? Sounds like a decent proposition to me. I'll try not to get in the way.

This is kinda awkward, but do you think you could spare twenty bucks a day, just so I'm not moochin' off everybody? I'm a pretty damn good knife thrower. Used to even do it blindfolded just for kicks at parties.
All right! Now what can I do for ya?
Jeez! Do you know how little twenty bucks gets ya? Ah, well... Have it your way.
You get me to Estoni and I could probably make some arrangements to get some fuel. Don't know if it interests you, but it's a thought.
This is too bad. I will leave Arulco. I will not be a problem.
Good. We kill traitors together.
Is now time for YOU to die!
Is now time for YOU to die!
Need help... urgently.
You are kind.
I happy not to fight you. I do not want money.
You have my money. You are a thief!
I am mercenary, too. I take job with man named Mike. I did know nothing of this Queen Deidranna and her sick ways. I am not happy with job. I wish I was back in Mother Russia.
You should have paid me, you infidel!
Well... it was just a thought.
Settled, let's get to it.
You sick son-of-a-bitch.
You sick son-of-a-bitch.
Ughhh - I'm hemorrhaging... Uhh - I'm weak...
Before we get into any heavy conversation, I'd feel a lot better if you took care of the gunfire. I'm not crazy about the hospital being in the middle of a combat zone.
I have my concerns about you. It's nothin' uh, personal, of course.
It will help keep things going around here.
Thanks, but no thanks. Using medical supplies from a stranger would have malpractice written all over it.
Thanks, but no thanks. Using medical supplies from a stranger would have malpractice written all over it.
Not today, I'm afraid. Someone's been ripping our stuff off. I couldn't find a bandage if your life depended on it.
Just the one wounded? That shouldn't pose any problems.
Looks like I have a full slate ahead of me today.
Though I hate to do this, I will have to charge you for any medical services rendered. Otherwise, we couldn't keep this place open.
Unfortunately, I'm going to have to charge you for use of our services.
I'll cut you a little bit of a break on the price. I wouldn't feel right otherwise.
Since you guys are for real, I'll only charge you for the cost of the supplies.
You guys are out there putting it on the line for us. The least we can do is give ya a freebie this time.

Ya got to promise me you won't tell anyone... I really appreciate what you're doing, so I'm going to play with some numbers and bury the costs of this treatment somewhere. It's hush-hush, and I can't do it too often.
I'll give ya a decent price on my services, but I will have to include the money you still owe me.
Tell them I'm on my way.
Don't mean to be a stickler about this, but I'll need the cash.
I wish I was in a position where I could do something better on the cost, but I can't. Hope you'll reconsider.
Good. Shouldn't be too long...
All right! It could be a while, just leave it in my capable hands.
The entire amount!
I'm pretty sure we've still got the necessary supplies... The hospital has an inventory problem. The few supplies we do manage to get our hands on, some employee keeps stealing.
Your efforts seem to be paying off. Sometimes I wish I was still part of it. But what's important is you're getting the job done.
Don't take this wrong. Working with you was an adventure, but I sort of got it out of my system. I think the best place for me is right here.

I've actually been giving it some thought. I wouldn't mind getting a firsthand piece of some of those thugs the Queen calls her army. I could be the team doctor, you know, ready to treat, right on the spot.
Don't mean to brush ya off, but I have to.
Okay... I am already in country. I will make you one time special price. Do not expect me to go lower. And you must not tell anyone I work for such low price.
Very good. You now have someone capable of leading and training team.
You have not heard of me I guess. This is most unfortunate. I shall leave country in search of others worthy of my services. Have a good one.
Remain calm... while I shoot you.
Remain calm... while I shoot you.
Urgent! Doctor!
A product of good training, I see.
I will consider it fees for my consultion. You are welcome.
You are lucky to meet me. Your timing is most fortunate. My contract with the Army of Arulco has just expired, and I am in search of employment.
You will look back on this day as being your wisest. The job you offer is of interest to me. However, the talents of man like Lt. Conrad Gillet are not without price.
It is you. You have money you owe me? This is all we have to talk about.
Come here baby!
Come here baby!
Blood! He he... Lots of blood.
Hey! No more blood.
You stop fighting first. I want to be alive to talk to you. It better that way.
Yeah... It sure sounds like fun. I was thinking of killin' her myself, but a...some company might be all right. Just don't be gettin' in my way, cause I won't let anything get in my way.
I don't have to steal it! Hey!
My name is Maddog. I heard about you.
You's gonna git a good whackin'!
You's gonna git a good whackin'!
Awww, I be gushin' blood out over here.
With this ruckus going on, I sure as hell don't feel like talking.
Ya lips are flappin' awfully fast there, stranger. Best be thinking who's ya yelling at. I don't take kindly to being chewed on by somebody who ain't kin.
Ma pa Daryl usually does all the talking and such.
Ma pa Daryl usually does all the talking and such.
I got myself chores to do...
I got myself chores to do...
Come with me, sweety-pie! Got a really nice spot in the barn for ya with the rest of the girls.
When I get ya, I'll fix ya!
When I get ya, I'll fix ya!
This hurts worse than a good spanking...
You know, while you were down there...
What the frig! Get rid of this crap first!
Well, it's like this. After I quit my old job, I needed to make some cash. So, I started sharpening knives. Next thing you know, it's,
Then, I'm fixing everybody's goddamn problems!
This whole friggin' country's completely out to lunch. I don't care who you are or what you're doing here, but if you want my two cents, shoot the bitch. She's been nothing but bad for business.
I'm going home. Talk to me tomorrow if you still need something fixed.
When I get ya, I'll fix ya!
What the frig! Get rid of this crap first!
This hurts worse than a good spanking...
Burn with your friends in hell!
Burn with your friends in hell!
I order you to find me a doctor.
You have served your purpose. Now leave.
How did you get to me? Leave at once!
Heh. A pathetic little tithe. Don't insult me!
Why me? What did I do?
Why me? What did I do?
I... think... I'm dying.
You are so kind to me.
It is not safe to talk now, not safe at all.
Please, you have nothing to gain by scaring me. Everyone here lives in fear of the Bloodcats. Can't you be more kind?

The people of Alma will be so grateful to you! I can hardly wait to tell them what you've done for us! It's a small piece of freedom, yes, but it means everything to us, to our children. Somehow, we will reward you.

I had hopes for you, you know. But, I suppose you haven't heard. Another boy died. Bloodcats got him. Eventually, the people of Alma won't worry about Bloodcats. We'll all be dead. But it's not too late, you know.
People are talking about you, about the Bloodcats.
It's not safe to stay near Alma. The Bloodcats are getting braver every day.
The Queen is hardly our worry. It's the Bloodcats that cause our fear. We've tried to kill them, but it was the hunters who died instead.
Fine, I'll speak my mind, then. If these hell cats aren't killed, we're all in serious trouble, and not just the people of Alma.

I... I know it's not your job here, but I don't know who else to ask. The Queen, well, she promises, but we have seen nothing, and just last night, another boy died. A baby really, only five years old.

The Bloodcats are vicious. They have EARNED their name. And lately, they have lost their fear of things human, drawing closer and closer to town. There is nothing we can do. Without your help, that is.
It is kind of you, and unexpected.
It is not your money I need, it is your help.
You made a big mistake, you fool!
You made a big mistake, you fool!
Oooh, I've been wounded. Someone is going to pay...
I was blind-sided. A stupidity. Never saw it coming.
It's not my war. You clean up your mess, and then we'll talk.
I am not sure what you're up to, but I'll take the cash.
Ya, that's really nice. But just whose freakin' head is it?
I knew you'd think things through. God... Ruttwen's even uglier in person.
This is not Slay's head.
This is not Slay's head.
For the last time, I want Slay's head, and I want it now!
This is not Slay's head.
Good! This little souvenir is going to put money in both of our pockets.
Good! This little souvenir is going to put money in both of our pockets.
Jackpot! Looks like we've got even more money coming to us.
Jackpot! Looks like we've got even more money coming to us.
I have a little sideline for you, if you're interested. This country is crawlin' with wanted terrorists. Terrorists with a price on their heads. Arulco is known as a safe haven for crazies.
Oh... One other thing, they're not wanted alive. I'll need their heads as proof that the deed's been done. Shouldn't be too distasteful for you. You are a mercenary.
I don't have that kind of cash on me right now. Give me twenty-four hours, and meet me back here. I'll have it for you then.
I need some time to get the cash together. Nobody thinking right would walk around this country with that kind of money. Give me 24 hours, and meet me at the bar in Drassen.
I'll need to keep the head. You will just have to trust me.
I knew you'd show up sooner or later.
Here's your money... It has been a pleasure doing business, and my offer is valid if you run into anybody else with a price on their head.
You might want to consider a career as a bounty hunter. You get to travel all over the world like an international garbage collector taking the trash out.
Ya, that's really nice. But just whose freakin' head is it?
I hear rumors... You have twenty-four hours to bring me the head of Slay Ruttwen. If I do not see it on the table in the bar in Drassen, you and I have no business left to do.
Slay Ruttwen, your head is mine...
Next time... I just want the head, you understand? I thought we were clear on this.
You know what I want.
You know what I want.
For the last time, I want Slay's head, and I want it now!
You and I are through. All arrangements are off!
What's your problem?
Life is a bitch!
Ugh! Bandage this!
At least you're trained.
Who the hell?
If you're willing to part with more, maybe we can work something out.
She is all yours. I'm out of here.
Those mercenaries, Queen. The ones causing all the trouble. You wanted them.
Yeah, Queen. You do. You want me to tenderize them?
Gladly Queen. How do you like this?
Yeah! I'll star-spangle you!
Aw, come on! You are full of it! Queen, just look at them!
Right, Queen!
Queen?
You are demented!
You are demented!
I cannot treat my injuries... I need assistance.
Thanks. Feels a little strange to be on the receiving end.
Once you get the fighting under control, maybe then, we can talk.
It is too dangerous right now to help you. We are being watched.
Thank you.
I can't take medical supplies or medicine from you. You'll have to clear it with administration.
I can't take medical supplies or medicine from you. You'll have to clear it with administration.
I'm terribly sorry, but I don't have the necessary supplies to heal anyone. We were cleaned out. Hopefully, we'll get a shipment in the next couple of days.
I'm sure we can handle another patient.
You're going to be keeping me busy for a while. I hope things are going better for you than they appear to be.
Very well... I'll be right there.
I'll attend to it, though I will have to charge you for my services. The money will allow me to give the people around here the medical attention they need.
Of course, as distasteful as it is, there will be a charge for the treatment.
Seeing how you're fighting for the betterment of Arulco, I'll give you a bit of a break on the price.
I wanted to let you know that we all appreciate what you're doing. And just to show you what I mean, I'm only asking you to cover the cost of the treatment.
We've all decided to waive any fees for our services. This treatment is on the hospital.
Seeing how you've helped the Grahams with their son, there'll be no charge for this treatment, and I'll keep my fees to a minimum from here on in.
I wanted to let you know that we all appreciate what you're doing. And just to show you what I mean, I'm only asking you to cover the cost of the treatment.
Very well... I'll be right there.
Of course, you'll have to pay for the treatment, now, in cash.
Well... If you change your mind or things take a turn for the worst, you know where to find me.
Very well, then... leave everything to me, and I'll get things fixed up right.
Okay, leave them with me. I'll get them all back on their feet before you know it.
I'll need all of it.
I just hope I don't run out of medical supplies. It seems someone's been stealing from us. They're probably selling it on the black market.
I'm sorry, but I have patients to attend to.
I have to tell you, I had my doubts when you first got here. But you've proven that you're out to win this war, and the town of Cambria stands solidly behind you.
Just thought I'd mention that I realize you're mercenaries and you're in this for money, but we need you. We need you to stay with it. You're the last hope for this country.
Guess where your body's going! Heh-heh-heh-heh.
Guess where your body's going! Heh-heh-heh-heh.
Help me here... I... I can't die...
You have no idea. Thank you.
Settle the shooting first! I don't want to die, especially talking to you.
I don't want nothin' from you.
Okay! So you know who I am. So what if I worked for the Queen? I just happened to enjoy working with insects. Big insects! She told me I was working too hard. I needed a vacation.

Okay, okay... I'll tell you all I know about the Crepitus. Just relax... They reproduce quicker than rabbits. A lot quicker. They grow damn fast, too. And the older they get, the more dangerous they are.
Okay! Enough already... There's an old fellow I used to work with named Gabby. He knows how to make this stuff that lets you sneak around the insects without them bothering you.
Ya fixed yerself fine this time!
Need... a physician.
Kind of ya.
Think there be other problems here ya better contend with first, before we be talking.
Course I'll take it! Won't do nothing for it.
First, it's gonna be you. Then your buddies, and then your whole damn family! They dinnae call me Mayhem for nothing!
Number's up, sucker.
I... need... a... doctor.
Thanks, eh? Feeling better, eh.
I don't want to be a target, eh? You quiet things down first.
Thanks, eh? I was running a little low.
I'm gonna chop you up in little pieces, man!
If...I could...I'd kill you.
If...I could...I'd kill you.
It...It...hurts.
All...right....
I was just looking...looking for gold dust in the mines. And...and I saw a hole that...that went down...down below the mines. I saw it...it attacked me fa...fa...fast.
If I had a gun, you'd be dead, you weeny bastard!
I'm in pain... serious pain... but there's a hint of pleasure to it.
I won't do nuthin' for it. That, you can be sure of.
Woah! PANTSUIT LORETTA 6: THE MEN ARE AWAY. I haven't seen this one. Thanks!
Get out of here!
You never have nuthin' Hans! Your For Woman By Woman section is next to empty. You got the same three films...all starring Twin Peakes. She's been dead for more than five years, Hans!
What about ordering some new stuff, huh... Like Titanik, or Bad Jill Humping, or As Sore as it Gets...
Yeah, yeah, yeah, you're just lucky you're the only Adult store in this backwoods country.
Well, that's it, Hans. I'm tired of your poor selection. I'm leaving, and I'm not coming back until you get some new stock.
If I had a gun, you'd be dead, you weeny bastard!
Wanna wait until it calms down around here?
You don't want to buy any of the products in this place. I've gotten some really bad rashes.
You're messing with the wrong man...
You're messing with the wrong man...
We'll pretend you are ignorant, and you do not know who you are threatening. Do it again, and we'll pretend that you are dead.
You were warned...
I will put this money towards improving my little town.
Good. However, we have a minor problem. It seems someone has found out where I do my banking. This certain someone has made, let's say, an unauthorized withdrawl.
A downpayment, but we are not quite squared off yet.

I knew you were a sensible person. And to show you I am the same, I will erase this whole episode from my mind. I mean, how could you have known it was my money? And you are enjoying San Mona, are you not?
Peter Klaus. Some of my closer friends call me Kingpin.
I understand we're in for some entertainment. I never miss a good bout, especially not when there's new blood in the battle.
You impressed me. Showed a determination I did not believe you had. You know, you should drop by my house sometime. It is south of here. Not very far, within walking distance.
We will have to pick this up another time...
We will have to pick this up another time...
I trust you are enjoying my town.
I built it from nothing, by doing people favors. I am a generous man who enjoys seeing people entertained. I am also an avid collector who appreciates the rarity of some of the finer things in life.
Let's get right to the point. Did you manage to get me the Golden Chalice of Chance or not? I can barely wait to see it.
Ah... It is just like I remembered it. Magnificent, simply magnificent.
And this, my dear friend, is for you. Perhaps, you will find some of the attractions in town to be worthy of your hard earned dollars.
I hope you are bringing me good news and money. Time is running out, and so is my patience.
Peter Klaus. Some of my closer friends call me Kingpin.
Another bout. I am looking forward to a close one.
A most enjoyable event. Whenever you wish to partake in another, please make the necessary arrangements with my assistant, Darren.
Good. However, we have a minor problem. It seems someone has found out where I do my banking. This certain someone has made, let's say, an unauthorized withdrawl.
I trust you are enjoying my town.
I built it from nothing, by doing people favors. I am a generous man who enjoys seeing people entertained. I am also an avid collector who appreciates the rarity of some of the finer things in life.
You will pay dearly.
You will pay dearly.
Another slip of your tongue with me, I will not tolerate.
How dare you! You were told...
It is passed last call, Gentleman. I get very little sleep as it is.
I have a club to run.
Back so soon? My fighters are resting. If it is another extreme bout you are looking for, then you will have to come back later.

Kingpin has a message for you. He wants the money you stole from him. You are not welcome to fight here until then. Two other things. There is a charge of 25 per cent for your error, and you must deliver it to him personally.
I have a club to run.
The only money I handle is fight-related. You have a problem with this, you take it up with Mr. Klaus.
I would imagine you are here due to our extreme fighting competition. I would also wager a guess that you, yourself, wish to participate in this battle of courage.
I see... well, there will be other occasions.
As soon as you give me the cash, we shall get this underway.
I believe I mentioned that there is a betting minimum of $1,000 per fight.
There is a betting limit of $5,000 dollars per fight.
Very good. Mr. Klaus, the owner of the club, is a huge fan of extreme fighting. He insists on being here for every bout. We will get the match underway the moment he arrives.
Excellent! I shall send someone for Mr. Klaus. I am sure he will not take too long.

The rules are simple. Heh, there are so few of them. The fighters will enter the ring; you first, of course, 'cause you are the guest. I will ask the fighters if they are ready, and we start at the bell.
Are the fighters ready?
That is it! You are disqualified. You have forfeited the match.
Ah yes, we have our winner!
A remarkable performance. Here are your winnings.
That is too bad. There were moments where it could have gone either way.
Would you care for another?
I am sorry about this, but there will be no fighting for a while. My fighters have taken some time off to rest and train. Give them a chance, and they will be better prepared for you.
I see... Have you changed your mind perhaps?
Here to partake in another exhibition of your courage, no doubt? By now, you are familiar with how everything works.
Back so soon? My fighters are resting. If it is another extreme bout you are looking for, then you will have to come back later.
As soon as you give me the cash, we shall get this underway.
Are the fighters ready?
I cannot wait to see my brother.
Why? Why?
Why? Why?
We have to be going. We have already spent far too much time in San Mona.
Help me. I need... to get to a hospital.
No, Madame Layla is the only one permitted to handle money.
Angel sent you? We must be careful. If Madame Layla knows why you are here, Mr. Klaus' men will descend upon this place quickly. He is the real owner, and he thinks nothing of human life.
It is hard to believe I am here with you, Angel. You mustn't worry... everything went fine. The people you sent to get me were extremely clever and discreet. It is great to see you, Angel.

It is hard to believe I am here with you, Angel... But we must hurry! There were problems getting out. Kingpin's men will not be far behind. They will kill me if they see me, Angel. Other girls have met the same fate.

It is hard to believe I am here with you, Angel... But we must hurry! There were problems getting out. Kingpin's men will not be far behind. They will kill me if they see me, Angel. Other girls have met the same fate.

You don't owe me any money.
That's not enough. I said $950.
That's too much. I don't have change. Do you have the exact amount?
Thank you. I am sure you'll be satisfied with your purchase. The vest is extremely durable. It will no doubt last you a lifetime.

I am going to put my faith in you. You seem trustworthy, and I sense this may be my only chance... My sister, Maria, was taken from our home in Meduna just over a year ago. She is being forced to work as a prostitute.
Maria! Can it be true? God bless you... It is a miracle.
It is so good to see you, Maria. I am sorry for all that has happened. We will start over, somewhere safe. Were you able to get away quietly? Will they be looking for us?
I was afraid this would happen. We must leave immediately! I warned you about this... Mr. Klaus will hunt us down like dogs! Let's go, Maria.
You have done exactly as I asked. I am forever grateful... I no longer have need of this leather shop. It is yours to do with as you wish. Here is the deed...
This treated leather vest is yours as well...

Maria has told me in the past that she knows where Mr. Klaus hides his money. It was information I would never dare make use of. You, however, may be capable of stealing from Kingpin... and getting away with it.
I promised the soldiers who rescued you a reward. I will leave the deed to the shop here. Hopefully, they will find it. We must go now.
I did not know if you were coming. You have done exactly as I have asked. We are forever grateful. I left the deed to the leather shop as a token of my appreciation.
This treated leather vest is yours as well...

Maria has told me in the past that she knows where Mr. Klaus hides his money. It was information I would never dare make use of. You, however, may be capable of stealing from Kingpin... and getting away with it.
Those idiots. It is exactly what I told them not to do. We will leave immediately.
I don't conduct business with bullets flying.
I have a very unique item for sale. It is something I believe might interest you. A kevlar-treated leather vest... Very fashionable, yet extremely practical. I could let it go for, say $950 dollars.
It is best to keep your head low and go about your business in San Mona. It can be a very dangerous town otherwise. It costs me a fortune in fees just to operate my shop in peace.
And how will you be paying for that?

I am going to put my faith in you. You seem trustworthy, and I sense this may be my only chance... My sister, Maria, was taken from our home in Meduna just over a year ago. She is being forced to work as a prostitute.
I hope my dad's not drunk when I get home. He's gonna kill me... Well maybe, if I'm lucky, he won't be there.
You're crazy!
You're crazy!
Uggh... mommy... mommy!
I bet ya won't even give me a chance to spend it before you force me to go home.
Just leave me alone.
No more foolin' around, okay? I'll do exactly what you tell me - I promise!
Okay, I'll go with you. Just don't let anything happen to me. My mom will be really disappointed if she isn't the one that gets to kill me.
I tell you what... Since I know you're gonna save my skin with my mom, I'll let you in on something... Somebody's stashing cash down here. There's tons of it!
I got lost, Mom... I took a wrong turn, and then I was a little confused as to where I was... and then they found me... I was really lucky, Mom.
Okay, Mom... Uhh, dad hasn't been drinking, has he?
What ya doing? You can't just leave me here! I'll be good... I swear.
I don't want to join you. I don't want to have anything to do with you. I just want to be left alone down here.
What ya doing? You can't just leave me here! I'll be good... I swear.
Make the shooting stop!
Okay, I'll go with you. Just don't let anything happen to me. My mom will be really disappointed if she isn't the one that gets to kill me.
Okay, I'll go with you. Just don't let anything happen to me. My mom will be really disappointed if she isn't the one that gets to kill me.
Okay, I'll go with you. Just don't let anything happen to me. My mom will be really disappointed if she isn't the one that gets to kill me.

You, are a dead bastard!
You, are a dead bastard!
A doctor... A doctor soon.
I am terribly sorry. I do not have any more time.
You, are a dead bastard!
A doctor... A doctor soon.
Yes.
I am terribly sorry. I do not have any more time.
The selection this time of year is excellent.
Point out what it is you are interested in.
Maybe you should show me what you want to buy...
You weren't invited, turdfly!
You weren't invited, turdfly!
You don't want to be pushing yourself on people in this town. We aren't like the rest of the country.
Look, I tried to be polite, but you're making it personal. Either you drop the attitude, or I drop-kick your nambyass-ass the hell out of here.
What are you, stupid? You don't understand English? Understand this, twit!
Muchos gracias.
Carmen was around. Told me to pass the word... He's in Cambria, if you're looking for him.
If you're looking for Carmen, well ya just missed him. He's headed to Drassen.
Over there is someone I think you should meet. I can vouch for him. Carmen comes in here a lot.
Have you checked out the extreme fighting at the club? I'm sure, it's...something ya'd get into. Just tell Darren that Frank sent ya. He'll take care of everything.
If you haven't had the chance to see San Mona, I recommend you put aside some time to spend at the Shady Lady. Ask about the full massage. It includes a facial which you will not soon forget.

You're lucky you ran into me... Kingpin knows it was you who stole his money. If I was in your shoes, I'd give it back to him personally within the next 48 hours. Course, he'll want more than you took, but he might spare your life.
Kingpin has put the word out about ya. A friendly piece of bartender advice from someone who's known him for a long time, pay every last cent of it back before they come looking for ya.
The boss is driving me crazy. Kingpin's driving everybody crazy. His favorite hooker disappeared, and he's tearing up the town looking for her.
Ha, ha! Liquor license? We don't need no freakin' liquor license.
You weren't invited, turdfly!
Yer goose is cooked!
Yer goose is cooked!
A tip... It must be my smile.
Ya looking to get your ass kicked?
Maybe this will make ya understand.

You took money from Kingpin. He's says ya got 48 hours to give it back to him. If ya don't, he wants me to kill ya. Be prepared to pay more than ya took, cause that's the way the boss works these things. Ya been warned.
Ya want to know something, ya ask Mr. Van Haussen.
Take a hike.
What ya doing here? Mr. Van Haussen told ya it's closing time!
I'll get him, Boss.
Guess you want to go in, hunh? Well, I guess you look okay.
Suck on this, sleezeball!
Suck on this, sleezeball!
I can't be bought.
Threaten me again, and I'll be the last person you ever threaten!
Oh, yeah?
Kingpin is expecting you. You'll find him in his gaming room to your right.
Kingpin is expecting you. You'll find him in his gaming room to your right.
Kingpin is expecting you. You'll find him in his gaming room to your right.
You're not expected, so you're not welcome.
You raving lunatic, you. You...you bully!
You raving lunatic, you. You...you bully!
Oh! Oh! Oh my! What? Talk now? Are you crazy?
Oh... ah... ah... the PAIN!
I'll be sure to put this in my tip jar.
So many big burly men... And it's not even my birthday.
Look at those muscles... I bet you work out... Everything looks so tight.
I hope you're not here to get an eagle on your shoulder. Simply everybody wants the eagle. Boring, boring, boring...they're so passe.

I won't be doing tattoos forever, you know. No, my big burly man, Kyle Lemmons will one day be the proprietor of his own leather boutique... with custom embroidery done by you know who... Kyle Lemmons - artiste.
Oh, my...oh, my...stop my panting heart! The deed to Angel's leather shop. Can it be? Why, yes... of course I'll buy it from you. I'll give you everything I have for it.
Here you go... ten thousand dollars. Oh, I can't believe this! I will never, ever, forget you. You made my dreams come true. You sweetheart, you.
Oh, my...oh, my...stop my panting heart! The deed to Angel's leather shop. Can it be? Why, yes... of course I'll buy it from you. I'll give you everything I have for it.
Ya bloody fool!
Ya bloody fool!
Aye, could ya stitch a wounded friend?
Oh, how kind of ya.
Aye, not right now! You finish what ya started first!
You look a wee bit familiar. Did I not run into ya in me gun running days? Aye, a nasty business that was, just to be scrapin' together nickels and dimes here and there.

And I also caught a rumor that there may be some type of strange creature movin' about the mines. Wish I could confirm it. Aye... If she be true, I'm bettin' there be a pretty penny in a piece of such a beast.

Aye... If ya be finding yourself possessing anything I might be looking for, you come a callin'. I be givin' ya top-dollar for it. You can find me in one of the bars. You might even find me still in this one.
Could I interest you in buying a poor, thirsty, brother-in-arms a drink?
Aye. A wee somethin' to quell the nerves.
Ya bloody fool!

I can't wait 'til we get there. Haven't taken the bird out for a spin in a long while.
You're one sick mother, Cap.
I got no plans on havin' anything to do with you, Cap! You guys tried to kill me... Remember?
I need help... First aid...
Thanks for getting me back on my feet, Cap.
Get things under control, then we'll yak all ya want.
What's happenin', Cap? I thought you were gonna get me to my eggbeater...
Better change your tone, Cap! Or you're gonna have to take chopper lessons.
I'm strictly freelance, Cap. You can book me by the ride, but you ain't never gonna own me.
Better change your tone, Cap! Or you're gonna have to take chopper lessons.
You're grounded, Cap, 'til I see my money.
Money's always cool, Cap!
Conditions ain't right for flying today, Cap. Sorry.
Skyrider. That's what they call me. Ain't nobody around here that can fly an eggbeater like me.
You get me to my eggbeater in Drassen, Cap, and we might be able to work out some business.
There's my baby. She looks just fine, Cap. We're in business...
Okay. Just so we're straight on this, I'm a pilot, not a soldier. I'll do what I'm told 'til I get there, but ain't getting involved. I don't want no gun. I don't want to have to kill nobody.
Just show me on the map where ya wanna go, and I'll get ya there.
What's happenin', Cap? I thought you were gonna get me to my eggbeater...
What's up, Cap?
Thought you forgot about me.
What is wrong with you!
What is wrong with you!
Ah, thank you for your help.
Okay, don't go crazy on me. I'll see what I can do... I'll ask around. But I'll need time. Uh, maybe you can come back tomorrow.
It hurts... I fraggin' hurt.
Take care of the fighting, then I take care of you.
Coffee money. Help me keep my eyes open, if you know what I mean.
Well... Whatever you were expecting isn't here. Could try again tomorrow.
Ya... I got something for you.
You don't scare me. I don't care what you do to me. I don't know nothing about your missing stuff.
It wasn't me, man, I swear.
I have good news for you. It wasn't easy, but I managed to find your missing stuff. Even threw in a couple of extra things I found lying around just to make up for the inconvenience.

We, uh, have a problem with your shipment. I wasn't here, you understand, but when the plane landed, some people in Drassen would not let your stuff be unloaded. The pilot left with your goods still on the plane.
Personally, I don't care who wins the war. I just don't want no more shooting near the airport.
A lot of people come in and out of here, you know. I can't be babysitting your shipments. Well, at least not for free.
Ya... I got something for you.
Why you do this?
Why you do this?
Must see doctor... Much blood.
I will remember this.
I no do nothing until shooting stops.
I sorry. But many people in Drassen do not... like... trust you. I must work and live in Drassen. It is not easy. Talking with you will make it hard.
In front of line for you.
I have nothing for you today. Maybe come soon on plane.
Plane just make delivery. I no have time to check yet for you.
I have something for you in warehouse. I take good care of it.
I have big delivery for you. It very heavy.
Bad news. Plane with delivery crash in mountains. I make little mistake. Pilot make bad turn...everything gone. Many pieces... Big mess.
We have problem. Delivery go to bad airport. I check on this for you.
I do everything I can do. Delivery comin', but keep going to bad airport. I think it in Bulgaria.
I have very good news for you. I find your delivery. It go everywhere in world, but I find it for you.
Bad news. Delivery disappear. I talk to many people, many airports. It nowhere. I sorry about this, but I can do nothing.
I am very new at this job. But I start at right time. With much luck, you will make Arulco good place.
I wish you victory in Meduna. The whole country wishes you much luck.
God will get you for this!
God will get you for this!
Holy Mother of Mary... I, I'm bleeding everywhere.
You are truly God's child.
Holy tabernacle! Have the hostilities ceased?
Ah...a contribution. I... I'll have to mail you the receipt. I don't have any with me.
Well, that's mighty thoughtful of you. A little something to pick up the spirits.
It's too bad that young woman, Ira, isn't with you. I haven't seen her in a while. She's quite something, you know. I really enjoy conversing with her.
I haven't seen you around, Ira. I was worried, perhaps, something had happened to you. You are looking well, as always.
Miguel Cordona needs my assistance? Well... I think I can put together some food and supplies. Fuel, as Miguel is probably well aware, remains next to impossible to acquire.
Deidranna does not approve of organized religion. She only tolerates me and my congregation because she does not want the attention of outsiders, especially the Holy Father.
The food supplies have made it to Omerta. I've developed a network of people to keep them fed for the next little while.
If you're looking for Carmen, he left word that he was headed over to San Mona. Which seems like an appropriate place for him.
If you're looking for Carmen, he left word that he was headed over to San Mona. Which seems like an appropriate place for him.

Deidranna will burn slow..ly in Hell. That, ya can put your money in the bank on...  Ever notice there's no cemeteries in Arulco? She lays claim to the dead... Takes them right, right off the grieving families.
I seem to have run out of sacramental wine. You wouldn't happen to have any would you? I mean...ah, any type of alcoholic beverage will do.

She's an evil woman, that Queen Deidranna... A surefire candidate for hell. She, you know, she kills everyone that gets sick... or was born less than perfect. There aren't no sick people in Meduna. That's a fact...

She's an evil woman, that Queen Deidranna... A surefire candidate for hell. She, you know, she kills everyone that gets sick... or was born less than perfect. There aren't no sick people in Meduna. That's a fact...
I've said too much... And haven't drank enough.

Things were different before... The Chivaldori family were good people. They must all be turning uncomfortably in their graves. Trying to rest, troubled souls, knowing what has happened to their beloved country.
Well, that's mighty thoughtful of you. A little something to pick up the spirits.
Well, that's mighty thoughtful of you. A little something to pick up the spirits.
God will get you for this!
Nah... things aren't what they used to be. Maybe one day... Must be positive. There are still plenty of good-intentioned souls in the world.
You have betrayed us. God have mercy on your soul.
I mu-must seek h-help...
I mu-must seek h-help...
Have you seen a small boy? Oh, I am worried sick. I have not seen Pacos in hours. I've looked everywhere. He is nowhere to be found.
You are being watched. If you cause any harm, you will not leave Omerta alive.
No, it is not safe to talk now. The Queen's men...
I have no time for anything until I find my boy. I can only pray that the army has not captured him.
Why are you scaring the child? What is your purpose in Omerta? You are not regular soldiers.
How could it be that you were sent by Enrico? He has been dead for more than... ten years.
Hmmm... A letter from Enrico Chivaldori. He has not forgotten us...
You want me to believe that you are working for a dead man? I would suggest that you leave Omerta before you, yourself, become one.
Give me a reason to believe that Enrico sent you, and perhaps I will have reason to speak with you.
They have been sent by Enrico Chivaldori. They are here to help us, Dimitri. They must speak with Miguel. I would never bring them here without proof of this.

Enrico has enlisted mercenaries to aid us in the struggle. I have a letter addressed to Miguel. It is signed by Enrico himself and contains details of the night we helped him flee Arulco. Details only he would know.
Here...
Very few people are aware that he's alive. As far as most of the people in Arulco are concerned, he was murdered over a decade ago.
Who are you? What is this?
We had given up hope of ever hearing from Enrico again. Who would believe that someone living in the comforts of exile would care about this dismal country?
Me? No. My children are in need of me.
You have betrayed us. God have mercy on your soul.
You're making a huge mistake!
You're making a huge mistake!
You're wasting your breath. Just do whatever it is you're going to do.
Have... the decency.. to put me... out of my misery.
You're making a huge mistake!
You trying to bribe me? I will confiscate this money as evidence.
No more torture... No more pain... please...
No more torture... No more pain... please...
Ahhhhhh... Why must I die so slow?
Don't touch me... Don't touch me anymore.
Do not harm me... I know nothing... I am weak...
What in tarnation is going through that head of yours?
What in tarnation is going through that head of yours?
Jesus Christmas! Can ya patch me up here?
Oh, well-la, well-la, much, much better. Yeah. Perfect. Feels great. You're a lifesaver, you are.
Don't get to see people much. Sorta like it that way, but I do miss conversing, if you know what I mean. Haven't had the chance to sit down and have a heart-to-heart in a long while.

I can tell you how to get up real close to those buggers. Got my own little secret recipe. Lets you walk amongst them like you were one of 'em. Blend it myself with blood and tissue from Crepitus parts.
I used to take care of the Crepitus for the Queen. Me and another fellow named Ricardo, though everyone called him Rat, used to dump dead bodies down into their lair to make sure they were well-fed.
You ever find yourself in trouble, you have to get around back of 'em. The Crepitus have their life organ right at the base of their rear. You hit that, and it smarts 'em good. Real good!
So, you met Rat, and he told you about my special creature concoction that lets you walk amongst those buggers unnoticed. Make it myself, you know, from the blood and tissue of Crepitus parts.
Those buggers are as blind as my father. Do everything by smell. You gotta sorta watch it though, stuff wears off after a while. Always carry an extra bottle on me just to be sure.

I suppose Rat told ya, I used to work for the Queen. Didn't have much choice really. He and I used to feed the Crepitus the bodies of the dead. Queen wanted 'em well-fed, so they wouldn't leave their lair and eat her miners.
Been hiding out here ever since I ran off... Those creatures are quite something. Got a Queen just like us. Don't know which one of 'em is meaner... or uglier.
I'm not quite sure how them buggers came into being. Word was the Queen had some DNA scientists do some experiments, and then shot every last one of them when she saw what they had created.
What in tarnation is going through that head of yours?
Jesus Christmas! Can ya patch me up here?
What in tarnation is going through that head of yours?
You bloody wanker!
You bloody wanker!
Oh, bloody hell...
Kind of you.
What the bloody hell is going on here?
Uh, very well then, thank you.
Listen here. I don't have time for this.
Good Lord man! Look, I became the head scientist by diligent work, not by talking to people. Now, if you'll let me get back to my research. Thank you.
Oh, shut the bloody hell up! Good Lord man, I could kill you with any number of compounds. Now let me be.
Bloody hell! Do tell me, when I relate the story of this conversation to friends back home, would you prefer I call you
or
? Now, get away from me.
Bloody hell! That's it. I can't work under these conditions! She promised security, secrecy, and a workplace free of interruption. Right! Well, I am NOT giving my life for her promises.
Have it your way. I don't have anything more for Christ's sakes.

How can I put this lightly. I'm not a part of this any more than you feel you are. We're just on different sides, but it's all about money, isn't it. Now, I've given you what you've come for. Leave me this small dignity.
You'll find what you want in those crates.

How can I put this lightly. I'm not a part of this any more than you feel you are. We're just on different sides, but it's all about money, isn't it. Now, I've given you what you've come for. Leave me this small dignity.
I don't understand!
I don't understand!
Get me a doctor?
Yeah, that did the trick.
I'll make time for you, once you inflict some peace on the area.
There are probably others who need it more.
Kind of quiet around here since the mine's been closed. It's too bad the lode went dry. I must say, I miss the responsibility the job gave me. You know, I personally carried the last nugget out...
Things could be going better. I'm still having problems recruiting workers. Hate to say it, but the people around here lack confidence in your ability to win this thing.

I have some alarming news. It appears we're nearing the end of the ore deposit. Could be a matter of days before production starts to drop-off, then a couple more days before the mine is closed altogether.

I was hoping I'd get to meet you. I knew when I did that me and my men would be finally liberated from the clutches of that slave driving... dictator! The Queen's in a class by herself when it comes to cruelty.
Unfortunately, I had to close the mine. A couple of my men say they spotted huge, hideous bugs down there. I don't know how true it is, but I can't allow anyone to work until I'm sure it's safe.
Thank God! Thought you'd never be back. My men have been through an extremely rough time. I hope you'll make every effort to prevent that from happening again.
Thought you might want to be brought up-to-speed. The mine is currently running at full capacity. My men are behind you one hundred percent.
You're turning out to be the answer to all our prayers.
We've had another incident with those creatures. I had to shut down the mine again.
Just you wait until Kingpin hears about this.
Just you wait until Kingpin hears about this.
I'd rather live than deal with you! Take care of this mess first!
I'm not having a good day. Somebody kidnapped one of my girls. Poor Maria, I get goosebumps just thinking about what they might be doing to her.
I always appreciate someone who knows what they want.
We don't cater to your type of needs, dear. Though there's a woman named Brenda Drake that might be interested. You'll probably find her browsing at the adult store.
I'm sure you will find something or, rather, someone here that will catch your fancy. My girls were all chosen with creating a wide selection in mind.
I'm afraid I don't recall who you were interested in last time. Do you have a favorite, or are you looking to expand your horizons?
All my girls are busy right now. You can come back later, or you can wait if you like. Probably just be a couple minutes. Most men don't take very long.
Yes, as a matter of fact, things have quieted down.

Maria is one of our newer girls. She's four hundred dollars a head. A little shy, likes to pretend she doesn't like it. Her room is at the end of the hall. You can be forceful if you like. She likes that, too.
Carla would be ideal. She's my most experienced. You could visit with her for 100 dollars per person. Naturally, she's not my most youthful girl.
If you were looking for something really special, I have Cindy. She's five hundred per person. But you'd have to promise to be very gentle. We celebrated her eighteenth birthday last night.
May I suggest Bambi for something really different. Mr. Klaus calls her a freak of nature. At 300 dollars apiece, she's someone that you'll be talking about for a long, long time.
I'll need to be paid in advance. That's how we do things around here.
Have you had a change of heart?
That's okay, there will be other occasions. You'll come around. Everyone does.
The two of you may go now.
Can I interest anyone else?
I can't take that. I'm not sure who you want. Let me tell you who's available...
All my girls are busy right now. You can come back later, or you can wait if you like. Probably just be a couple minutes. Most men don't take very long.
Carla, I believe, is free. She's a hundred dollars.
There's Cindy at five hundred dollars.
There's Bambi, who's simply waiting for someone with three hundred dollars and the need for some loving.
We have Maria, who's not for everyone, but well worth the four hundred dollars if you like the resistant type.
If two of you would like to split a room, just double up the amount.
Didn't I tell you about our no-girl policy? Oh, well. Maybe she won't say anything. It's probably a good time to think about expanding the business anyway.
Only people who have paid me for a girl's time are allowed back there.
You know what to do, Billy.
You are a savage. A human without heart.
You are a savage. A human without heart.
I... must get to Cambria... for treatment.
You have earned my appreciation.
I cannot even think of conversing with all this fighting going on...
A donation... They are few and far between.
Feel free to tour the ruins. I ask that you respect the heritage and tranquility of Arulco's wonder. Please do not fire your weapons or otherwise disturb the grounds.

The Chalice is in the showcase for the enjoyment of the wealthy who live in Balime, and she did not want the peasants of the countryside to prosper from its blessing. However, it is locked up behind heavy security.

She had the Chalice in Balime so the wealthy could enjoy it, and the peasants of the countryside could not prosper from its blessing. I have heard, however, that it has been stolen, and its whereabouts are unknown.
Greatness would be bestowed upon the one who returns it to Chitzena. To have it here, once again, may very well unite the country.

My highest appreciation. It is wonderful. I did not believe I would ever see the Golden Chalice again. The people will hear of your deed. Word travels very fast here. Your journey shall be facilitated by their gratefulness.
Why? Why?
Why? Why?
Have you found him yet?
Help! I need... a... doctor.
Protect me. Please...
Thank you for your concern.
Normally, I would't take money from a stranger, but we really need it. I'll see that it gets put to good use.
You go to your room, mister. And you just wait 'til your father gets home.
That boy... He's a good kid, you know. He just has a little bit of a wild streak in him. Thank you... I'll try and keep a closer eye on him next time.

I've been hoping to see you. I wanted to thank you for returning my Joey. I'm trying to keep a better eye on him... He's a bundle of energy, that boy. Maybe there's something I can do to show our appreciation...

What's your problem? You gettin' a little testy. Don't let yer nerves get ya going. Save it for the Queen.
Look, I got me a plan, and if you want to be on the receiving end of it, it's fine with me! But I suggest you relax, and let me go about ma business!
Don't know what I was thinking last time we met, or if I was thinkin' at all. But ya might be interested in knowing just where the Queen's secret weapons plant is located, don't ya think?
Ya broke her, did ya? Well, I guess ya be needin' another. Okay, no cause for panic. It will require a bit of time, I'm afraid. A few days for sure.

I guess that's it then. Best of luck with it. And when ya find the Queen, give a smile over her dead body for me. Well, ya best be off. I'm certain she's looking for me. Wouldn't want us both getting caught.
You asked for it man... and here it comes!
You asked for it man... and here it comes!
Man, this hurts like hell.
Cool. You saved my skin...
Finish what you started, and then we can talk.
Round here, people generally choose their purchases before they pay for 'em.
Look. It's nothing personal, but I gotta make a living. People see me yakking with you, and I'm back hawking porno in San Mona.
Look. It's nothing personal, but I gotta make a living. People see me yakking with you, and I'm back hawking porno in San Mona.
Look. It's nothing personal, but I gotta make a living. People see me yakking with you, and I'm back hawking porno in San Mona.
There's a good buzz going around about you guys. People starting to get on your bandwagon. Starting to smell ten years of hell coming to an end.
Sorry, man, but I got a life, too. We're closed for the night, so if you want to hurry it along, I'd appreciate it.

About the only thing you won't find here is guns. Can't keep 'em. Every time I get one to sell, one of them hillbilly Hicks comes down here and steals it. That fraggin' family has been terrorizing Cambria for years.
As you can see, I'm out of business, man. Fraggin' hillbillies came into town and took everything I had at gunpoint. Loaded my whole fraggin' inventory onto a couple of cows and headed off.
I got nothing to sell and no money to buy.
As you can see, I'm out of business, man. Fraggin' hillbillies came into town and took everything I had at gunpoint. Loaded my whole fraggin' inventory onto a couple of cows and headed off.
I got nothing to sell and no money to buy.
Man, this hurts like hell.
Finish what you started, and then we can talk.
Finally, those Hick boys and their still-brained father have been taken care of. Made yourself a lot of friends around here. Be good for business, too. Thanks, man.
Looks like you're interested in doing a bit of dealing. That's my game, man.
I trusted you!
I trusted you!
Lord! This hurts something awful...
You're good people. Thanks.
It's a little wild around here to be having a chat, don't you think?
Man, if you're gonna give handouts, I'd rather you find someone who needs it.
I'm having a problem getting men to work. Army buttered their bread for so long, they figure it's only a question of time before you desert us, and things go back to the way they've always been.
Man, is it ever good to see ya, Greg. Looks like you been to hell and back.

Looks like my mine falls on your side of the fence now. Can't say I'm unhappy about that. Be more than a pleasure to hand over every last dime I can squeeze out of that hole, if it will help put the Queen in her grave.
We got a serious problem down below the mines. Some sort of prehistoric bugs or something. Not sure what they are, but they eat people, and I ain't letting anyone work down there 'til they're gone.

I was wondering when I'd see you again. Suffered a setback, huh? Well... you're back in control now. I want you to know that we all prefer working for you by a long shot. Hopefully this time, it'll stay that way.
Man, is it ever good to see ya, Greg. Looks like you been to hell and back.
So, you joined up... Gonna say hello to Deidranna for the both of us, I hope.
Don't get me wrong, they hate the army. They'd love to see them wiped out. But they're terrified, and it ain't because a stranger comes down here that they're going to forget where they live.
There is something you can do to rally the workers and make me a friend for life at the same time. You can get my brother's ass the hell out of that prison in Tixa. He has no business being there!

Of course, busting my brother, Dynamo, out of Tixa has already given this town something to get excited about. He's a popular guy in these parts. I want to thank you. You and I are gonna get along just fine.
The army killed his kid right in front of him, then raped his wife... All because he missed a meeting or something. Greg's doing time in that hell-hole for nothing.
Heard word that you got my brother out. Good work, man. Everyone around here is pretty impressed by your efforts... Now, you got a free cell to put that Queen bitch in, once you get a hold of her.
Pretty disappointed to hear about the passing of my brother. It's sad to say, but his fate was pretty much decided that night the army barged into house and destroyed his life. I'm gonna miss him.
Wanted to let you know that we're running on full steam. Never saw my crew more determined about their work.
I don't know why you guys came down here to help us, but I'm sure glad you did. You're doing one hell of a job!
Those ancient ants are back, man. I'm keeping the mine closed 'til you do some more exterminating.
Man, is it ever good to see ya, Greg. Looks like you been to hell and back.
YOU'RE the target, and I don't miss.
Target in sight.
Need a medic here.
Just like old times. Not that it changes anything.
That wouldn't buy a minute of my time.
Aw, don't look so surprised. It's never been about glory for me. It's about money.
Hell and tarnation!
That's it! Get 'em boys!
Damn it! This stings!
Well, that's better. Where was ya when I got that nasty infection?
Lookit! I ain't gettin' dragged into yer fight. You take care of it first!
Well, I'll be! I haven't seen me any of this since the Queen cut off our assistance program! I mean, she made up fer it in other ways, don't be getting me wrong.
Yous are welcome to visit, just don't be nosin' around, starting any trouble, and for God sakes, stay off the cows. I been having problems with a few of the boys, ya see.

Look, I'm not partial to being pushed around. Think you got guns? Think you got bullets? Well, let me tell ya, I got me guns, too. And you be seeing them right close soon, unless you find some manners.
You's a cute lookin' one. Got nice teeth and all. You wouldn't be interested in relocatin', would ya? Move to Arulco and become kin. Got me more boys than I got cows.
Damn it. I divorce the wife and marry you myself if you's interested. Woman's back been on the fritz for darn near ten years anyways. So, what say, honeypie? Yous want to be a Hick?
Heehaw! We's done bagged ourselves a live one, boys. Give ya every gun in my collection for this pretty thing. Yous just head on over there and help yourself. Gots me a shed full of 'em.

Why ain't that a shame. I was looking kinda forward to seeing those pretty teeth of yours at the family meals. Well okay, but if you know of any other pretty-teethed woman hungry for a man, yous send 'em over to see me.
Ya know, I wouldn't mind talking to the girl over there with the pretty teeth.
You low life!
You low life!
Oh... is doctor here?
Oh, is so much better.
Is not safe to do business now. Can no enjoy drink! Stop fighting first!
Is time for you to go now. We stay open late for you, then everybody want it, and I never sleep.
De Santos are also known for our amazing similarities. Dere are five of us, we are identical quintuplets. It is funny. We sound same, speak same things, and we are all bartenders in Arulco.
Well, everyone except Manny. Poor Manny. He was born a day after de rest of us. He has spent his entire life trying to catch up. We hope one day he will be one of de Santos bartending brothers too.
I believe you know of us. My brother has spoken of you, de soldiers who are going to save Arulco. I tell you, we wish you de best of luck cleaning out de mess dis country is in.
My brothers tell me about you. We no meet yet. But, meet one, you meet them all, no? Heh. This what people say... Women, dey confuse us all de time. And me, I confuse de woman, let me tell you dis.

I bet you think you have seen me before. I have heard very much about you from my brothers and de others. You are de one who will give birth to a new Arulco, an Arulco free and equal for everyone. De people are in awe of you.

It is a great time in de history of de Santos brothers. We are all bartenders now, even Manny, who many said would never be able to open a beer, has joined us. Our dead father sheds his tears in pride.
Yes, you are not the first to notice dat we look very similar. I do not understand, since de differences are obvious to me.
Yes. Many have mentioned dat I am de most handsome of de brothers.
Perhaps, you have had too much to drink already.
You low life!
Oh... is doctor here?

You low life!
You insult de Santos family! You garbage!
You insult de Santos family! You garbage!
Ooh. Uch. Uh. Dis hurts. Need strong drink. Get me Shirley Temple.
Oooh. Much better. Me get drink.
No talk now... de glasses get all shot up. Wait 'til is quiet.
Oh! Dat's it! Is time for me to go home. I no forget last call, did I? Ah, well.
I do dis until I learn de trade. Bartending hard, no? You have de liquor, de glasses, de money, much to do. But one day, I, Manny Santos, will be famous bartender like my brothers.
I like dis place. Charlie, de bartender, he is no mean to me. Teach me how to do job. Yesterday, I learn to make ice. I wonder, though. Charlie, sometimes he mix funny drinks. I no think dey good.
De money is de hardest part for me. I only count to five. I work on it though.

Why you yell at Manny? What I do? Maybe I fix you up with one of Charlie's mean drinks! Is no good to drink those! They hurt peop... oh. Wait. You no hear me say dat. Good bartender no talk, Manny. No talk.
Dis mean I bartender now, no? Sudden opening is like dream come true.
You insult de Santos family! You garbage!
You insult de Santos family! You garbage!
Ooh. Uch. Uh. Dis hurts. Need strong drink. Get me Shirley Temple.
No talk now... de glasses get all shot up. Wait 'til is quiet.
You madman! Don't ever look for my help again.
You madman! Don't ever look for my help again.
Can't take this pain...
That'll heal up just fine now.
It's too risky. We'll talk later.
No, but I'll tell you what, there are people who need it.
I've worked this mine for over nine years. Quite something... Nothing, but a hole now. I ain't ashamed to say, I cried when she tapped dry. Don't know how I'm gonna get by now.
I realize production is low, but I'm doing the best I can with the limited number of people I can recruit. It's just not easy. People around here are leery.
News on this end is bad. We're reaching the last of the ore deposit. Probably just a question of time before the mine peters out to nothing. I guess I sorta knew it was bound to happen.
I'm the guy in charge of the mine, and it's damn good to meet you. Me and some of the guys are willing to keep on working. Turn the day's take, less the usual expenses, directly over to you.
We got a problem. I can't get anyone to go down into the mine. There's a rumor spreadin' around that there's beastly insects movin' about. I'm gonna have to shut her down.
For a while there, I didn't know if I'd ever see you again. I had to do some quick talking just to stay alive. I beg of you not to let that happen again.
News on this end is good. We've maxed out our daily production. And let me tell you, you guys are developing quite a reputation for yourselves around this town.
I don't how you guys do it, but I'm sure pleased to see it happening. Keep it up! I'm waiting for the day when I can stand in line for the chance to sit on the Queen's throne.
Had to shut the mine down again. Don't think you killed all those beasty bugs the last time, 'cause one of them ate another one of the men.
Are you crazy? Do you know how many push-ups I can do? Just you wait.
Are you crazy? Do you know how many push-ups I can do? Just you wait.
Ugh! That which does not kill me makes me stronger.
Say, you didn't implant something while you were doing that, did you?
Do your job, then maybe, if it's safe, we can actually converse like adults.
I had this coming to me. About time.
Oh, no... You're one of those mercenaries. I was in the Army once, full of dope-puffing socialists. You probably heard of me, Calvin Barkmore, broke every record they keep track of.
Naturally, seeing how me and my team are the best darn miners in the world, we've already managed to clean out the whole mine. There's no ore left.
You do realize I'm pretty much working alone and doing as much as any five miners combined. You want things to go any faster, you'll have to convince more people to work here.

I realize it's hardly believable, but me and the team of men I hand-selected actually managed to dig out the whole mine. That's right, the whole mine. You probably won't be able to find an ounce of ore by week's end.
The mine's closed. There's someone's drug-induced version of monsters down there. The phallic-symbolled beasts are eating my men. Eating men, I tell you! It's an artsy-fartsy nightmare.
Come to think of it, where the hell have you been? You left me to single-handedly fend off an army. I had to throw the whole lot of them through windows. Don't you ever pull that stunt again.
No need to thank me. I'm quite satisfied working for my meager salary, but I got everybody working faster and harder than any other mine. We are at maximum production.
I know, you actually seem to be doing all right without me. But I tell you, if I had time and was on your team, this thing would be finished by now. I'm not one to let things drag on.
Look! Can't you get this right, you warped liberal dimwit? Those bung-holed monsters are back. Do I have to go down there and fix 'em once and for all myself?
And I believed in you!
And I believed in you!
Aw... you got anything that will help me with the pain?
Was a close one, wasn't it?
It's not safe to talk. Come back and see me when the fighting's over.
Thanks. I'll make sure it goes to good use.
Don't know if you're aware of this or not, but this mine's been totally exploited. We closed her down. Nothing left to extract.
I'm having a hard time motivating the workers. Some of them are wondering aloud whether you've bitten off more than you can chew.

I have some disturbing news, I'm afraid. The mine is just about tapped out. The Queen has been working her hard, and now the ore is coming to an end.  We'll get what we can out of it, then we'll close her down.
Looks like you're the boss now. Don't mind at all... I'll see how much support you've got amongst the men and put them to work immediately.
I've lost one of the workers to some sorta huge insect. I know it's hard to believe, but now nobody will go back into the mine. I have no choice but to close it down.
I hope you're here to stay this time. Workers went through hell. Deidranna wasn't too happy with us. Promise me you'll do a better job of protecting us from here on in.
Pleased to report the mine is back running at full speed. You have the full cooperation of the town.
I'm glad to see our hard work is paying off. For a small group of guys, you sure know how to run circles around that Queen and her army.
Those huge insects are back. I've had to close the mine again. You'd better take care of them this time. I don't know how many more times I can convince the workers to go back down there.
